episodeTitle: He Hates the Straw Hat Crew - Iron Masked Duval Makes His Appearance
description: The Straw Hats meet a mermaid named Camie and her starfish companion Pappag, who seek their help in rescuing their friend Hatchan from kidnappers. Learning that Hatchan has been captured by the Macro Gang and the mysterious Iron Mask Duval's Flying Fish Riders, the crew agrees to help in exchange for directions to Fish-Man Island. As they head toward the rescue location near Sabaody Archipelago, they're attacked by the Flying Fish Riders, who retreat upon recognizing the Straw Hat flag and report to Duval that his nemesis is approaching.

openingSong.title: We Are! (Animation One Piece 10th Anniversary Ver.)

events.title: Camie's First Appearance
events.description: The kissing gourami mermaid Camie formally introduces herself to the Straw Hat Pirates after they saved her from a Sea King. She thanks them profusely, mentioning this was the twentieth time she'd been eaten by one, showing her tendency to get into trouble.
events.significance: Introduction of Camie, who becomes a recurring ally and friend to the Straw Hats, and whose rescue mission leads them to Sabaody Archipelago.

quotes.text: Thank you so much for saving me! That was the twentieth time I've been eaten by a Sea King!
quotes.speaker: Camie
quotes.context: Camie introduces herself to the Straw Hats after being rescued

events.title: Pappag's First Appearance
events.description: Pappag, a talking starfish and fashion designer, introduces himself to the Straw Hats. The crew is amazed that a starfish can talk and even more surprised when they learn he's a famous designer and Camie's master.
events.significance: Introduction of Pappag, who serves as Camie's companion and mentor, and later becomes successful fashion designer in Fish-Man Island.

events.title: Hatchan Mentioned as Camie's Friend
events.description: Camie reveals that her fish-man friend who runs a takoyaki shop has been kidnapped. She mentions he's an octopus fish-man, which excites Luffy at the prospect of eating takoyaki. The crew doesn't yet know this is Hatchan, a former enemy from the Arlong Pirates.
events.significance: Sets up the rescue mission and the eventual reunion with Hatchan, a former antagonist who will become an ally.

quotes.text: My friend runs a takoyaki shop! He's an octopus fish-man!
quotes.speaker: Camie
quotes.context: Camie describes Hatchan to the crew without naming him

events.title: Human Trafficking Business Revealed
events.description: Pappag explains that human trafficking is a booming business near Sabaody Archipelago, with multiple kidnapping crews operating in the area. He reveals that mermaids are particularly valuable in the slave trade, explaining why the Macro Gang constantly tries to capture Camie.
events.significance: Introduces the dark reality of the slave trade in One Piece, foreshadowing major events at Sabaody Archipelago including the auction house and Celestial Dragons.

quotes.text: There are several kidnapping crews in the area and human trading is a booming business in Sabaody. That's why Macro tries to kidnap Camie all the time - mermaids are expensive!
quotes.speaker: Pappag
quotes.context: Explaining the danger of the slave trade near Sabaody

events.title: Macro Gang Reveals Hatchan's Capture
events.description: When Camie tries to call Hatchan on a Den Den Mushi, Macro answers instead, revealing he and his crew have captured Hatchan. Macro taunts Camie, explaining that while they normally couldn't beat Hatchan, they succeeded this time by teaming up with the Flying Fish Riders. He reveals octopus fish-men fetch high prices in the slave market.
events.significance: Introduces the Macro Gang as antagonists and reveals their alliance with Duval's Flying Fish Riders. Shows the betrayal of former Sun Pirates crew members who now engage in slave trading.

quotes.text: We finally beat Hatchan! Normally we'd lose, but we teamed up with the Flying Fish Riders this time. I'm gonna sell him - octopus fish-men are rare and worth a fortune!
quotes.speaker: Macro
quotes.context: Macro taunts Camie about capturing Hatchan

events.title: Duval and Flying Fish Riders Mentioned
events.description: Pappag explains that the Flying Fish Riders are a very active kidnapping gang in the area, led by a mysterious man in an iron mask called Duval. He mentions that Duval is looking for someone and checks every passing ship, creating fear in the region.
events.significance: First mention of Duval and his gang, setting up the mystery of who he's looking for and why he wears an iron mask.

quotes.text: The Flying Fish Riders are very active kidnappers in this area. Their boss is a guy in an iron mask called Duval - he's looking for someone and checks every passing ship.
quotes.speaker: Pappag
quotes.context: Warning the Straw Hats about Duval

events.title: Straw Hats Agree to Rescue Mission
events.description: Nami negotiates with Camie, agreeing that the Straw Hats will help rescue Hatchan in exchange for information on how to reach Fish-Man Island. Luffy enthusiastically supports the mission, especially excited about the prospect of takoyaki.
events.significance: The crew's decision to help Camie leads them directly to Sabaody Archipelago and sets up the reunion with Hatchan, who will guide them later in the arc.

quotes.text: We'll help you save Hatchan in exchange for directions to Fish-Man Island!
quotes.speaker: Nami

events.title: Camie's Fish Communication Ability
events.description: Camie demonstrates her mermaid ability to communicate with fish using sonar waves. She calls a school of fish to show her the way to the Flying Fish Riders' base, amazing Luffy and the crew with this unique power.
events.significance: Showcases one of the special abilities mermaids possess in the One Piece world - the ability to talk to fish and call them using sonar.

events.title: Approaching Sabaody Archipelago
events.description: As the Straw Hats follow Camie toward the Flying Fish Riders' base, they approach the area near Sabaody Archipelago. The location is described as being five kilometers east of Grove 44.
events.significance: The crew's first approach to Sabaody Archipelago, the final island in Paradise before the New World.

events.title: Flying Fish Riders Attack the Thousand Sunny
events.description: The Flying Fish Riders launch an aerial assault on the Thousand Sunny, bombing the ship from above while riding their giant flying fish. The attack catches the crew by surprise as enemies approach from the air.
events.significance: First combat encounter with the Flying Fish Riders, demonstrating their unique fighting style using flying fish mounts.

events.title: Zoro and Luffy Defend Against Bombs
events.description: The Flying Fish Riders drop bombs on the Thousand Sunny, but Zoro and Luffy defend the ship. Zoro uses his 72 Pound Cannon technique while Luffy uses Gomu Gomu no Pistol to deflect the explosives. Meanwhile, Brook and Chopper cower in fear from the aerial assault.
events.significance: Demonstrates the crew's ability to defend against aerial attacks and shows the contrast between the fighters and more timid crew members.

events.title: Flying Fish Riders Recognize the Straw Hat Flag
events.description: After their initial attack, the Flying Fish Riders recognize the Straw Hat Pirates' flag. Upon this recognition, they immediately retreat under Duval's orders, choosing not to continue the assault despite having aerial advantage.
events.significance: Reveals that Duval has specific interest in the Straw Hat Pirates, creating mystery about his connection to the crew.

events.title: Iron Mask Duval's First Appearance
events.description: At the Flying Fish Riders' base, Duval appears for the first time wearing his imposing iron mask with red hair tufts. When his crew reports that the Straw Hat Pirates are approaching, Duval declares he cannot wait to have his revenge on 'the man who ruined his life,' revealing his intense hatred for someone in the crew.
events.significance: Introduction of Duval as a mysterious antagonist with a personal vendetta against the Straw Hats. The iron mask and cryptic statement about revenge creates intrigue about his identity and motivation.

quotes.text: The man who ruined my life is approaching... I cannot wait to have my revenge!
quotes.speaker: Duval
quotes.context: Duval's response upon learning the Straw Hats are coming

events.title: Macro Confirms the Trap for Camie
events.description: At the Flying Fish Riders' base, Macro reports to Duval that he successfully lured Camie to the base and that their plan is going well, revealing that Hatchan's kidnapping was specifically designed as a trap.
events.significance: Reveals that the entire kidnapping was a calculated trap to lure the Straw Hats, not just a random act of slave trading. Foreshadows the confrontation between Duval and the crew.

quotes.text: I lured her to the base. The plan is going well.
quotes.speaker: Macro
quotes.context: Reporting to Duval about successfully baiting Camie and the Straw Hats

quotes.text: Thank you so much for saving me! That was the twentieth time I've been eaten by a Sea King!
quotes.speaker: Camie

quotes.text: There are several kidnapping crews in the area and human trading is a booming business in Sabaody. That's why Macro tries to kidnap Camie all the time - mermaids are expensive!
quotes.speaker: Pappag
quotes.context: Explaining the slave trade around Sabaody

quotes.text: We finally beat Hatchan! Normally we'd lose, but we teamed up with the Flying Fish Riders this time. I'm gonna sell him - octopus fish-men are rare and worth a fortune!
quotes.speaker: Macro

quotes.text: We'll help you save Hatchan in exchange for directions to Fish-Man Island!
quotes.speaker: Nami

quotes.text: The man who ruined my life is approaching... I cannot wait to have my revenge!
quotes.speaker: Duval
quotes.context: Learning the Straw Hats are coming to his base

themes.description: The episode introduces Camie and Pappag, who quickly befriend the Straw Hats and will become recurring allies throughout the story.
themes.symbolism: The crew's willingness to help strangers in need reflects their core values and leads to meaningful relationships.

themes.description: The dark reality of the slave trade is introduced, showing that even in Paradise, corruption and evil flourish near the seat of World Government power.
themes.symbolism: The proximity of the slave trade to Sabaody Archipelago (the last stop before the World Government's headquarters) highlights systemic corruption.

themes.description: Duval's cryptic statements about revenge and 'the man who ruined his life' create intrigue and tension as the crew unknowingly walks into a trap.
themes.symbolism: The iron mask represents hidden identity and the mystery of Duval's past.

characterSpotlights.development: Camie is introduced as a friendly but trouble-prone mermaid who easily befriends the Straw Hats and seeks their help in rescuing her fish-man friend Hatchan.
keyActions: Thanks the Straw Hats for saving her from a Sea King
Introduces herself and Pappag to the crew
Reveals her friend Hatchan has been kidnapped
Calls fish using sonar to guide the crew
Leads the crew toward the Flying Fish Riders' base
quotes: Thank you so much for saving me! That was the twentieth time I've been eaten by a Sea King!

characterSpotlights.development: Duval is introduced as a mysterious masked figure who leads the Flying Fish Riders and harbors intense hatred for someone in the Straw Hat crew.
keyActions: Orders his Flying Fish Riders to retreat after they recognize the Straw Hats
Declares his intent for revenge against 'the man who ruined his life'
Waits at his base for the Straw Hats to arrive
quotes: The man who ruined my life is approaching... I cannot wait to have my revenge!

characterSpotlights.development: Pappag is introduced as a talking starfish and fashion designer who serves as Camie's mentor and provides information about the dangers around Sabaody.
keyActions: Introduces himself as a starfish who can talk
Explains the human trafficking business near Sabaody
Warns about Duval and the Flying Fish Riders
Accompanies Camie in seeking the Straw Hats' help
quotes: There are several kidnapping crews in the area and human trading is a booming business in Sabaody.

mangaDifferences.difference: The episode adapts content from Chapters 490-491 of the manga with extended scenes and additional reaction shots typical of anime adaptation pacing.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the beginning of the Sabaody Archipelago Arc, one of the most pivotal arcs in One Piece that will culminate in the crew's separation.
Camie previously appeared in a cover story arc in the manga (Chapter 195) with Hatchan before making her main story debut.
The opening theme 'We Are! (2008 Remix)' by Tohoshinki was created to commemorate the anime's 10th anniversary.

sources.title: We Are!/Tohoshinki (2008) Remix - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Episodes 279-1070 did not feature ending themes, with the time instead used for extended openings.

sources.title: One Piece Music - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Macro, Gyaro, and Tansui are former members of the Sun Pirates who left after Jinbe became a Warlord, showing the dark path some fish-men took despite Fisher Tiger's anti-slavery legacy.
Duval's iron mask is later revealed to parallel Sanji's childhood trauma of being forced to wear an iron mask by his father.
